title: How to tell how many copies of my favorite books have been sold on Amazon - Quora

response.answer_text: Other than asking the author (who may not know) an exact answer would be difficult but you can get an estimate of how many it’s selling now. Look on Amazon for the ‘Paid in books’ or ‘Paid in Kindle’ rank. You’ll find that in the ‘Product details’ section. Copy the number. Go to a site which estimates the number of sales from that rank such as TCK Book Sales Calculator and enter the number (without commas) and whether this is an ebook or paper book. This one is selling about 8 copies per month - hardly stellar sales but better than average. A second useful site is Kindle Nation Daily’s eBook Tracker. You’ll have to register for this site (free) but you can use it to track the rank of books over a period of time. If the book is already being tracked there you can find it’s rank over a period of time. The book in the first example has been tracked since 2011 and has ranked between 47,786 and 771,446. Putting those numbers into the book sales calculator shows it’s been selling between 80 and 3 sales per month.
